p: The antimicrobial activity of the CA_EO and LS_EO are shown in Table 3. The CA_EO was the most effective against S. aureus, E. coli, C. albicans and H. pylori with inhibition zones of 25, 8, and 15 mm ( Figure 1), respectively and complete inhibition at the same concentration against H. pylori. The essential oil was shown to have antimicrobial activity against both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. Antimicrobial activity against E. coli was slightly less than that against S. aureus and C. albicans ( p < 0.05) at the same concentration. The MICs of the CA_EO against the bacteria mentioned above were 19.0, 36.0, 31.0, and 30.0 μg/mL respectively, and LS_EO against the bacteria mentioned above were 64.0 μg/mL.
